body.p:
darktable consists of several views or modes. There are five available views as described in this section. You can switch between views by clicking the view name at the top of the right panel the active view is highlighted or by using one of the key accelerators:
L
switches to lighttable
D
switches to darkroom
T
switches to camera tethering
M
switches to map
S
switches to slideshow
P
switches to print

section.title: Lighttable
Darkroom
section.p: In the darkroom view you develop a single image using the available modules (see ).

section.title: Tethering
section.p: This view is for shooting with the camera connected to the computer and remotely capturing images that will be downloaded and shown on computer screen (see ).

section.title: Map
section.p: This view shows images with geo-tag data on a map and allows manually geo-tagging new images (see ).

section.title: Slideshow
section.p: This view shows images as a slideshow, processing them on-the-fly (see ).

section.title: Print
section.p: This view allows you to send images to your printer (see ).
